main event: An assistant upland game bird biologist observed a delta-shaped, bluish and rose-colored object traveling at a high speed of about 800mph and making sharp maneuvers before disappearing from sight near Nampa, Idaho in 1949.
interesting points: The observer described the object as somewhat delta-shaped with a unique pale allergy rose color and pale blue metallic nature.
The object was estimated to be traveling at a high rate of speed, believed to be in excess of 800 miles per hour, and made a sharp U-turn before disappearing from view.
No noise of motors or air disturbances were heard or seen, and the observer saw no other objects in the sky at the time.
The witness immediately reported the sighting to the press after being unable to further observe the object.
The report also includes details on the physical appearance of the object, its maneuvers, and requests for radar information, witness statements, and photographs.
sighted object: delta-shaped, bluish and rose-colored object traveling at high speed
